text: One of our favourites in London. For Israeli food, it's not too oily or heavy but still absolutely delicious. Every dish is memorable and full of flavour

Amazing food and cocktails - lovely service. Dishes are unique and taste great!

nice food, small dishes, long line

Great atmosphere, funny and outgoing team, and tasty food and cocktails....

Absolutely amazing service and the food was excellent.
The dinning room is too small and crammed. Besides, There was a nasty smell of drainpipe. Waiters are rude and we picked up mistakes in the bill. Food is good.
Amazing restaurant!  Loved the dips, the Octopus and Chicken dishes.  Would have passed on the lamb and pork in future.  Still, 5 stars overall, great service and wonderful food!

Had a mid-week lunch here - good sharing plates and options, Jerusalem chicken has good flavor to it, but could have been more succulent. Other dishes were average.  The Bread and dips were fine but nothing to make this restaurant more favorable than other Mediterranean ones in London.
One of the best restaurants I have ever been into London so far. Food was fantastic :)

Probably one of our favourite restaurants in London. The food is very tasty and the environment is quite nice. We absolutely adore the Jerusalem mess (pictured). Even bought the Palomar cookbook, thats how much we love this place. Slightly on the pricey side but you wonâ€™t mind once you taste all that yumminess. Recommended!
Very good middle Eastern food. Decent service, nice atmosphere.
Amazing food.
Lovely food. Great service.  Busy. Recommend seating "in the back"

Explosion of flauver from middle east with a fresh Mediterranean touch.  The brioche bread is to die for, the Israeli head chef knows very well how to play with flavours and spices. I loved it! I will be back
My favourite place in London
Top notch. Sit at the counter. I live in NYC but when Iâ€™m in London Palomar is a Must

What a place! Had been itching to go here and decided to use the place for a big reunion dinner. The staff was extremely accommodating when it came to all our reservation needs despite it being a large party, and the service on the night â€¦
Nice food but very cramped inside

One of my favourite places to eat in London.  You sit at the bar.  Canâ€™t book so you need to put your name down.  I recommend doing this around 18:00 if youâ€™re prepared to eat later.  There are sittings for 18:00 that you can book in advanced if youâ€™re happy to eat early.

One of the best places I've eaten in London. Sat at the counter so got to chat to the awesome staff and watch the chefs in action. Food was absolutely fantastic - delicious, good portion sizes and I thought done in quite a unique way. Staff â€¦
Gooooooood foooooooood

One of my favorite restaurants ever. There is nothing on their menu that I tried and didn't like. I try to go every time I'm in London. I recently purchased their cookbook (they sell it at the restaurant). I am excited to try some of the recipes. Service is fast and friendly. Highly recommend.

I sat at the counter, and there's a fantastic energy there. Too much of London is merely pleasant and polite---this place was refreshingly fun and alive. Food and cocktails were excellent. I especially enjoyed the octopus but was dining solo so didn't get to try too many things. Will be back!
Excellent!
Wonderful food and service.

Another great place from the group that runs Coal Office and The Barbary (as well as places in Paris and in Jerusalem).
Great food, perfect services, they just know how to run a restaurant and make great food.
Every thing we ate was great, â€¦

Dishes served at Paloma are small and varied, so choose a few for each person and take your time enjoying each one. Palomar has an authentic Mediterranean:Middle Eastern fusion which delivers a wonderful culinary journey.

Get a seat at the bar for a great view of the chefs and cocktail guys at work. Great atmosphere and the food is wonderful. 

Just returned to The Palomar NYE dinner and it did not disappoint! Fantastic set menu great atmosphere and amazing service.
Great food but a bit expensive and crowded
One of favorite middle eastern restaurants in London, will definitely recommend to everyone

Aside from that, the food really isnâ€™t that great, itâ€™s definitely form over function. If you like The Breakfast Club â€¦

Excellent food and service, though a tad overpriced. Polenta was outstanding. Other dishes were great. Delicious meal, although paid the same as for a Michelin-starred menu and this wasnâ€™t quite up there.
